Sitting in the fields, we had for ’ some hours to endure a storm of rain and rloud thunder, and though completely drenched, esteemed ourselves fortunate in having escaped being swallowed up by the waveS, or struck dead by lightning. As the soldiers were gone, and the sailors forced to remain to look after the skiff, Ι set off on foot and alone, unless you call rain, wind, and thunder my companions; and after travelling through a country swollen with torrents, reached the metropolis a little before noon. The kindness of my former associates in our college, who all ran to embrace me, effaced from my mind the perils of the voyage, and the distress of the preceding night. Ι went to the Governor, and told him as afriend what measures he ought to pursue for the preservation of the colony and the FatherS, and for the coercion of the savageS.
